main.docTitle: Education (Exemption) (Private Schools Offering Non-Formal Curriculum) Order

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Order, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: ExemptedSchool
def.leadIn: exempted school (獲豁免學校) means a school that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provides any educational course other than nursery, kindergarten, primary, secondary or post secondary education; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not funded wholly or partly by any subsidy from the Government;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: The Hong Kong Certificate of Education Examination;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education Examination; (L.N. 24 of 2012)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: The Hong Kong Higher Level Examination;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: The Hong Kong Advanced Level Examination; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any examination the result of which is, in the opinion of the Permanent Secretary, equivalent to a result obtained in an examination mentioned in paragraph (a), (ab), (b) or (c); (L.N. 24 of 2012)

section.def: school workshop (學校工場) has the same meaning as in regulation 2 of the Education Regulations (Cap. 279 sub. leg. A);
science laboratory (科學實驗室) has the same meaning as in regulation 2 of the Education Regulations (Cap. 279 sub. leg. A);

def.name: SpecifiedInstitution
def.leadIn: specified institution (指明院校) means any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Lingnan University established by the Lingnan University Ordinance (Cap. 1165);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: The Education University of Hong Kong established by The Education University of Hong Kong Ordinance (Cap. 444); (6 of 2016 s. 2)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the University of Hong Kong established by the University of Hong Kong Ordinance (Cap. 1053);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: The Hong Kong Polytechnic University established by The Hong Kong Polytechnic University Ordinance (Cap. 1075);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: The Chinese University of Hong Kong established by The Chinese University of Hong Kong Ordinance (Cap. 1109);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Baptist University established by the Hong Kong Baptist University Ordinance (Cap. 1126);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the City University of Hong Kong established by the City University of Hong Kong Ordinance (Cap. 1132);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: The Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts established by The Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts Ordinance (Cap. 1135);

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology established by The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology Ordinance (Cap. 1141);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Metropolitan University established by the Hong Kong Metropolitan University Ordinance (Cap. 1145); (22 of 2021 s. 2)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: any Post Secondary College registered under the Post Secondary Colleges Ordinance (Cap. 320).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Exemption in respect of fees
section.content: An exempted school and its owners, managers, supervisor, principal and teachers are exempted from the requirements of the provisions specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1 subject to compliance with the conditions specified in Part 2 of that Schedule.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Exemption in respect of employment of teachers

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), an exempted school and its managers, supervisor and principal are exempted from the requirements of the provisions specified in Part 1 of Schedule 2 subject to compliance with the conditions specified in Part 2 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: The exemption under subsection (1) does not apply in relation to a person who is required—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the course of teaching, to carry out or supervise practical experiments or demonstrations in a science laboratory;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the course of teaching, to carry out or supervise practical activities in a school workshop; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to teach physical education.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Exemption in respect of teachers’ qualifications

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the teachers of an exempted school are exempted from the requirements of the provisions specified in Part 1 of Schedule 3 subject to compliance with the conditions specified in Part 2 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: The exemption under subsection (1) does not apply in relation to a teacher who is required—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the course of teaching, to carry out or supervise practical experiments or demonstrations in a science laboratory;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the course of teaching, to carry out or supervise practical activities in a school workshop; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to teach physical education.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Exemption in respect of principals
section.content: The managers, supervisor, principal and teachers of an exempted school are exempted from the requirements of the provisions specified in Part 1 of Schedule 4 subject to compliance with the conditions specified in Part 2 of that Schedule.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Exemption in respect of holidays and hours of instruction
section.content: An exempted school and its managers, supervisor and principal are exempted from the requirements of the provisions specified in Schedule 5.

section.name: s1
section.content: Section 14(1)(d), (g) and (p) (Grounds for refusal to register school) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s1
section.content: The inclusive fees for an educational course shall be calculated on an equal monthly basis. Other than the first instalment, each instalment of the fees shall be collected on or after the first school day of each month of the period during which the educational course is conducted.

section.name: s2
section.content: The inclusive fees for each of the courses offered, including the fees for each instalment and number of instalments, shall be displayed at a prominent place in the exempted school premises.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: On payment of the fees, a pupil shall be given a formal receipt, stamped with the chop of the exempted school, signed by the supervisor of the school and containing information on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the school name as specified in the certificate of registration or provisional registration of the school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the pupil’s name;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the course name;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the course venue in the school premises as specified in the certificate of registration or provisional registration of the school;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the date and amount of fees collected; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the month covered by the fees paid.

section.name: s4
section.content: Before enrolling for a course, a pupil shall be given a leaflet containing the course particulars, fees, information on the principal and teachers of the exempted school, and refund policies and procedures.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: A teacher who teaches in an exempted school shall possess the minimum qualifications for a permitted teacher, that is— (L.N. 24 of 2012)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: one or two certificates of the Hong Kong Certificate of Education Examination with an aggregate of 5 separate subjects at Grade E or a higher grade, including— (L.N. 24 of 2012)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: English Language (Syllabus B), or of a standard which in the opinion of the Permanent Secretary is equivalent to Grade E or a higher grade in that certificate; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Chinese Language; or (L.N. 24 of 2012)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: one or two certificates of the Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education Examination with an aggregate of 5 separate subjects consisting of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: English Language or Chinese Language at Level 2 or a higher level;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a subject from the New Senior Secondary subjects at Level 2 or a higher level;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a subject from the Applied Learning subjects with an “Attained” or “Attained with Distinction” result; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a subject from the Other Language subjects at Grade E or a higher grade; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a subject from the New Senior Secondary subjects at Level 2 or a higher level; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a subject from the Other Language subjects at Grade E or a higher grade. (L.N. 24 of 2012)

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: A teacher who teaches secondary 4 or 5 level in an exempted school shall possess—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a higher diploma issued by a specified institution or an associate degree of a specified institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a qualification which in the opinion of the Permanent Secretary is equivalent to a higher diploma or an associate degree.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: A teacher who teaches secondary 6 or 7 level or post secondary courses in an exempted school shall possess—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approved degree of a specified institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a qualification which in the opinion of the Permanent Secretary is equivalent to an approved degree.

section.name: s4
section.content: The subjects that a teacher is required to teach shall only be the ones in which the teacher obtains qualifications or has passed the public examinations.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: A supervisor of an exempted school shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within one month after any teacher commences to teach in the school, report to the Permanent Secretary in writing of the name, identity card number, qualifications and date of first appointment of the teacher;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include in the report a statement in writing certifying that the information on the teacher is correct; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take reasonable steps to ensure that the qualifications the teacher claims to have obtained are genuine.

section.name: s6
section.leadIn: A person specified in section 7 of this Part may not teach in an exempted school unless the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a registered teacher whose registration has not been cancelled under section 47 of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has a permit to teach which has not been cancelled under section 52 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: The person referred to in section 6 of this Part is one who—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: has been convicted of an offence under Part XII of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200) (which deals with sexual offences) or under the Prevention of Child Pornography Ordinance (Cap. 579); or (L.N. 113 of 2004)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: without prejudice to paragraphs (a) and (b), has been convicted, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, of any offence and received a custodial sentence, a probation order, a community service order or a fine exceeding $10,000.

subparagraph.name: i

subparagraph.name: ii

subparagraph.name: iv

subparagraph.name: vi
